commentary_data: Squad: Rohit Sharma(c), Ishan Kishan(w), Suryakumar Yadav, Cameron Green, Tilak Varma, Tim David, Nehal Wadhera, Hrithik Shokeen, Piyush Chawla, Jofra Archer, Arshad Khan, Jason Behrendorff, Ramandeep Singh, Shams Mulani, Sandeep Warrier, Vishnu Vinod, Riley Meredith, Duan Jansen, Dewald Brevis, Tristan Stubbs, Arjun Tendulkar, Kumar Kartikeya, Akash Madhwal, Raghav Goyal

Time for the ‘El Clasico’ of the IPL, but it must be said that so far these two teams haven’t been playing like the Barcelonas or the Real Madrids of the cricketing world. First to the hosts, who were given a good old thrashing by Virat Kohli and Faf du Plessis in the previous game. Their bowling lacks any real bite, and if the news about Jofra Archer’s injury is true it will look even weaker. On the batting front, despite all that star power it has been the uncapped Tilak Varma who impressed in the first game. A lot of questions to answer for the MI Paltan, but maybe a return to the Wankhede could be the right ignition for Rohit and the boys.

For Chennai Super Kings, opener Ruturaj Gaikwad has been in sublime form, with back-to-back fifties this season but MI have been his bogey team in the IPL, with four single-digit scores in five innings against them. The CSK batting has looked solid with Devon Conway and Moeen Ali also getting amongst the runs, but they’d expect more from their marquee signing Ben Stokes. Bowling is surely the weaker suit for Dhoni’s side, given the inexperience of their death bowlers. They were given a scare by LSG in the last game, but managed to close out the game. Today, traveling away from home could be a little more tricky.

But no matter what, this game always whets the appetite in the IPL, and this is perfect Saturday evening blockbuster. You wouldn’t want to miss it!! We certainly aren’t, so hang on tight for the toss and team updates now…..

Short leg-side boundary for the right-hander, just 63m and the fine-leg boundary is just 54m. Expect a lot of ramps today. The average score here in 2022 was 167, but teams will be hoping for more than that on a ground with these dimensions. However, if you remember CSK were bowled out here for 97 last year. There is a lot of grass, all the way through but no clear big patches. So the ball might do a little bit but if there’s dew it will slide on to the bat. Hoping for a really good cricket match but just wonder if the new ball will do a bit here, says

Pretty big match for all those involved, the rivalry goes back a long way. We’ve had some great games in the past and hopefully another good game today. In the second game, our batting was outstanding and with this new impact rule you can strengthen your batting. Rutu got us off to a very good start. Tonight looks like another good wicket so hopefully we can get some runs and defend it. We want to adapt well to the surface, there’s some pretty good bounce here for the seamers but we can try to use that as a spinner as well.
Time for the toss. MSD has a chat with SRT. Two GOATS of Indian cricket. We are almost set. Ravi Shastri booms out in Marathi as his deep voice pierces the air.
CSK are bowling.

We will bowl first. Think one of the most memorable venues not only the 2011 win but when we won in 2007, when we came back the reception we got was great. Generally got pace and bounce, you can play your shots We have a few injury concerns, . These are the two changes we have made.

We would have bowled first too. It's a good pitch, always a good pitch to bat. Always something in it for the bowlers. We just have to play good cricket. We have been really well in the last few days, spoke about what went wrong in our last game in Bangalore, hopefully we can get the result tonight. Unfortunately we have got an injury, I would not call it an injury but it is . It is a great feeling to be back at the Wankhede. The crowds have always been loud, look forward to playing in front of our home crowd.
(Playing XI): Rohit Sharma(c), Ishan Kishan(w), Cameron Green, Suryakumar Yadav, Tilak Varma, Tim David, Tristan Stubbs, Arshad Khan, Hrithik Shokeen, Piyush Chawla, Jason Behrendorff
(Playing XI): Devon Conway, Ruturaj Gaikwad, Ajinkya Rahane, Ravindra Jadeja, MS Dhoni(w/c), Shivam Dube, Dwaine Pretorius, Deepak Chahar, Mitchell Santner, Sisanda Magala, Tushar Deshpande
Rajvardhan Hangargekar, Ambati Rayudu, Shaik Rasheed, Akash Singh, Subhranshu Senapati
Ramandeep Singh, Sandeep Warrier, Arjun Tendulkar, Kumar Karthikeya, Nehal Wadhera

Even though Stokes and Moeen Ali are a big loss to CSK, they have good replacements in Pretorius and Magala, with the latter in good form with the ball, having taken a fifer in his last ODI against Netherlands. For MI the addition of Stubbs adds much-needed depth to their struggling batting even though Archer is a big miss.

It will be really interesting to see who will be the Impact players will be for both sides. CSK are in a huddle. Out come the players and umps. Rohit to take strike as Chahar practices his run. The countdown is done and we are ready. Two slips in for Chahar.
Chahar to Rohit, no run, good length on the stumps, no swing or seam, straight on, Rohit nudges to mid-wicket
Chahar to Rohit, no run, full outswinger outside off, shapes away, Rohit gets forward and lets it go

Chahar to Rohit, , Rohit is away. As are MI. Two balls was all he needed to size up Chahar, comes down the track and picks the inswinger on the stumps, Rohit lofts beautifully over extra-cover and timed it well too
Chahar to Rohit, 1 run, another inswinger on off and middle, Rohit closes the face of the bat and tucks it to deep backward square leg

Chahar to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, fullish on the pads, flicked through backward square leg via a thick inside-edge and it rolls away for one as deep backward square leg comes around. They are happy with one
Some issues with Chahar's left leg. He has stripped his trouser down and the physio is out with some tape. A break in play.  As soon as he bowled the last ball, Chahar called for the physio.
Some issues with Chahar's left leg. He has stripped his trouser down and the physio is out with some tape. A break in play.  As soon as he bowled the last ball, Chahar called for the physio.
The physio does his job but Chahar is in huge trouble here. He is ambling in for the last ball. Big problems for CSK.
Chahar to Rohit, , a floaty outswinger outside off, full, Rohit gets forward and slices the loft, clears mid-off though and it runs away
Definitely Chahar has issues with his hamstring it looks like
Tushar Deshpande to Ishan Kishan, no run, fullish on off, steered to backward point as Ishan Kishan gets forward
Ravi Shastri on air informs that Chahar has left the field and Senapati is on as a sub
Tushar Deshpande to Ishan Kishan, , swing for Tushar Deshpande, but starts down leg, Ishan Kishan flicks and misses, Dhoni dives to his right and saves a certain four by parrying it down
Tushar Deshpande to Ishan Kishan, leg byes, 1 run, Tushar Deshpande is getting it to swing but starts outside the leg-stump, Ishan Kishan flicks and misses, off the pad for a legbye
Tushar Deshpande to Rohit, no run, fullish outswinger outside off, Rohit defends away from the body and Jadeja dives to his left at backward point to save runs

Tushar Deshpande to Rohit, , Rohit gets a tad lucky, full outswinger outside off, he gets forward and lofts but the swing takes the thick outside-edge and flies away over backward point, beats third man to his right
Two slips in now
Tushar Deshpande to Rohit, no run, lovely outswinger outside off, full and beats Rohit on the big drive, late swing too

Tushar Deshpande to Rohit, no run, superb delivery and Rohit had no clue there. Backs away outside the leg-stump to access the off-side, but Tushar Deshpande shortens the length and gets outswing still, the extra bounce at Wankhede takes it over middle stump as Rohit looks to run it down
Magala to Ishan Kishan, , nice. Full and just outside off, Ishan Kishan gets forward and gently caresses it through point, into the gap and runs away
Magala to Ishan Kishan, no run, Magala shortens the length, good length and tight on off, defended to cover
Magala to Ishan Kishan, , that's a tad too full and wide outside off, Ishan Kishan unfurls a gorgeous cover drive, on a half-bent knee and wide of mid-off
Magala to Ishan Kishan, , cracks it away. On a back of a length on off, not a bad ball but Ishan Kishan has put it away with a pull over mid-wicket
Magala to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, back of a length on the body, pulled straight to the fielder at deep backward square leg
Magala to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, back of a length on the body, pulled straight to the fielder at deep backward square leg
Magala to Rohit, 1 run, full outswinger outside off, Rohit reaches for it and slices the drive to third man, on the bounce to the man
Tushar Deshpande to Rohit, , can't bowl there. Short and wide outside off, Rohit slashes and easily clears the short square boundary on the off-side, 62-metre hit
Tushar Deshpande to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length angling into middle and leg, flicked away to deep backward square leg
Tushar Deshpande to Ishan Kishan, no run, 139.1kph, sharp inswinger on the stumps, tucks up Ishan Kishan as it jags back, gloved on to the thigh and the ball rolls near Kishan's feet
Tushar Deshpande to Ishan Kishan, no run, slower ball off-cutter on off, Ishan Kishan gets forward to defend to gully
Tushar Deshpande to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, back of a length on the body, Ishan Kishan tucks it away to deep backward square leg
Tushar Deshpande to Rohit,  Bowled!!

Tushar Deshpande to Rohit,  Bowled!! Fantastic delivery and Tushar Deshpande is pumped. That's a cracker. Angled in on a back of a length and Rohit actually played that badly as I see the replay, the bat came down at an angle pointing towards mid-wicket, the ball just held its line and hit middle-stump. A good delivery made better by Rohit's tentativeness. The feet nowhere and the castle is down.
Santner to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, flat back of a length outside off, Ishan Kishan taps to mid-on for a quick single
A slip in for Cam Green.
Santner to Green, 1 run, pushed through on the pads, on a length, Green is off the mark with a nudge through square leg
Santner to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, Ishan Kishan backs away outside the leg-stump and Santner follows him with a dart, knocked down to mid-on who now is back
Santner to Green, , long-off is wide and Green has found enough to beat him to his right. Full and wide outside off, driven in the air and the timing takes it to the fence
Santner to Green, 1 run, good length drifting into the pads, nudged to backward square leg
Santner to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, quicker good length drifting into middle and leg, flicked to deep mid-wicket
Magala to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, fullish on off, Ishan Kishan gets forward to flick wide of mid-on and they come back for a couple
Magala to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, fullish on off, Ishan Kishan gets forward to flick wide of mid-on and they come back for a couple
Magala to Ishan Kishan, , bad ball and smashed. A low full-toss outside off, hammered wide of mid-off to his left. MI off to a good start
Magala to Ishan Kishan, , Magala is bowling badly here. This is a half-volley on off, Ishan Kishan gets forward and clears his front leg to loft powerfully over mid-on, one bounce over the ropes
Immediately Dhoni tells Jadeja to go and have a word with Magala
Magala to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, this is again in the slot, full outside off, Ishan Kishan loses his shape and slices it over extra-cover, just clears the fielder and comes back for the second
Magala to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, went for the yorker, it's a low full-toss on off, driven to mid-off for a quick single
Third man in. Long-off back. Meanwhile Ishan Kishan has a word with Green.

Magala to Green, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Green drives wide of Santner at extra-cover who gets across and parries it to long-off with a dive. Is grimacing as he holds his right shoulder, hope he is OK
It is hot out there. Ishan is being given some electrolytes and fluids. He is perspiring a lot too.
Jadeja to Green, 1 run, back of a length and down leg, tucked to deep backward square leg
Jadeja to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, good length outside off, cracked hard and straight to sweeper cover

Jadeja to Green, 1 run, Ishan Kishan did not want the single till the ball passed Jadeja to his right, Green comes down the track and pushes it, Jadeja can't cut it off and then they take the single quite easily
Jadeja to Ishan Kishan,  Caught!!

Jadeja to Ishan Kishan,  Caught by Pretorius!! Ishan Kishan shakes his head as he walks back. He looked to be in strife before this over, has that resulted in his dismissal? A back of a length delivery outside off, he goes for the flat-batted pull but miscues it and finds long-on. Pretorius goes back to reverse-cup with ease.
Jadeja to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, fullish on middle, Suryakumar Yadav gets forward to drive to long-on
Jadeja to Green, 1 run, good length on the stumps, knocked to mid-wicket which is vacant, Jadeja gets across and cuts it off with a slide but can't prevent the single
Jadeja to Green, 1 run, good length on the stumps, knocked to mid-wicket which is vacant, Jadeja gets across and cuts it off with a slide but can't prevent the single
Santner to Green, 1 run, back of a length and angling into middle-stump, pushed down to long-on
Was SKY walking off there? If Dhoni appeals, then more or less it is curtains for the batter. Let's see. Ball is close to both bat and glove.
Santner to Suryakumar Yadav,  Caught!!

Santner to Suryakumar Yadav,  Caught by Dhoni!! Another failure for SKY. He was walking off when he saw the ump signal a wide and waited. MS though knew and reviewed it straightaway after his appeal for caught behind is turned down. A nothing delivery down leg, but such is SKY's bad luck at the moment that he has gloved the sweep and MS takes a sharp catch. . MI lose two in two overs.
Santner to Tilak Varma, 1 run, back of a length on middle-stump, Tilak Varma is off the mark with a nudge to deep backward square leg
Santner to Green, 1 run, Santner is not at all giving air, another flat dart on middle-stump, Green pulls to deep mid-wicket on the bounce
There is a huge difference between Rohit, the Indian opener, to Rohit, the IPL batsman. He looks so vulnerable while playing in IPL

Santner to Tilak Varma, , good shot even though it was just wide of Rahane at slip. Quicker length delivery across Tilak Varma who steers it in the air and to the left of Rahane who barely had any time to react, the ball flew past his outstretched left hand
Santner to Tilak Varma, no run, fuller on the stumps, pushed back to Santner
Jadeja to Green, no run, flat and short outside off, cut to backward point
Jadeja to Green,  Caught&Bowled!!

Jadeja to Green,  Caught&Bowled!! CSK are spinning MI out. Superb catch by Jadeja and ump Gaffaney is ducking for cover. But Jadeja has caught it and rolled the ball to him. Smashed back at him, Jadeja hoists his hands up more in protect mode but the ball sticks in his right-hand and that's the end of Green. He hit it hard but far too close to escape from the clutches of a fielder of Jadeja's ability.

Three wickets in three overs and CSK's spinners are spinning a web. MI had a good powerplay despite the loss of Rohit but now it is CSK who are on top. Time for the others to bat around Tilak Varma and help MI out.
Jadeja to Arshad Khan, 1 run, back of a length on off, Arshad Khan whips it away to deep mid-wicket to get off the mark
Jadeja to Tilak Varma, 1 run, flat and on the stumps, Tilak Varma flicks to deep mid-wicket
Jadeja to Arshad Khan, no run, no air and Arshad Khan punches it back to Jadeja
Jadeja to Arshad Khan, 1 run, back of a length on off, Arshad Khan whips to long-on
Jadeja to Arshad Khan, 1 run, back of a length on off, Arshad Khan whips to long-on
Given out! For LBW or for caught at slip? By the time Arshad Khan has a chat with Tilak Varma, the timer runs out
Santner to Arshad Khan,  Lbw!!

Santner to Arshad Khan,  Lbw!! Plumb. Even if Arshad Khan had reviewed this, he was a dead dodo. Tossed up on middle-stump, pitches in line and Arshad is playing all around his front pad, flicks and misses, rapped on the pads and the ump has the finger up in a flash. No bat even as it is caught at slip by a diving Rahane. More woes for MI.
A slip in for Tim David.
Santner to Tim David, 2 runs, slower good length on the middle and leg line, worked in front of deep mid-wicket for a quick two
Santner to Tim David, 1 run, good length on off, Tim David goes on the back foot to push to long-on

Santner to Tilak Varma, , flat and a fine shot that, just outside off, Tilak Varma goes on the back foot and opens the face of the bat to place the cut wide of backward point  and gets it wide of sweeper cover to his right
Santner to Tilak Varma, 1 run, slower on the stumps, Tilak Varma kneels down and sweeps to deep backward square leg

Santner to Tim David, no run,  Blame the extra bounce at Wankhede for this. Nicely bowled, slower and drifts in to off-stump, then turns away, as Tim David gets forward to push, the bounce takes it over off-stump and hits Dhoni before ricocheting away to short fine
Jadeja to Tilak Varma, no run,  Flat and quick on the stumps, Tilak Varma whips and the inside-edge goes to short fine
Jadeja to Tilak Varma, no run, quicker back of a length around off, Tilak Varma steers to point
Jadeja to Tilak Varma, 1 run, fullish on middle-stump, Tilak Varma gets forward to flick to deep mid-wicket
Jadeja to Tim David, 1 run, fires it on a good length on off, Tim David gets forward to punch to long-off
Jadeja to Tilak Varma, no run, Tilak Varma makes room outside the leg-stump and Jadeja slows it down, on the stumps, Tilak mistimes the cut to the point region
11 matches and still waiting for a last ball thriller. It can’t get better than MI vs CSK to have a start to it.
Jadeja to Tilak Varma, 1 run, quicker good length on the stumps, flicked to deep mid-wicket
Pretorius to Tilak Varma, 1 run, slower ball off-cutter on a good length on the stumps, tucked to deep mid-wicket

Pretorius to Tim David, no run, Tilak Varma has rammed into Pretorius and for a moment the South African is down, but gets up. Driven hard to Magala at mid-off, a fumble and Tilak wanted a quick single, sent back, Pretorius in trying to field the throw was unware of Tilak getting back and the bat went into the allrounder's body. Luckily no damage done

Pretorius to Tim David, no run, Tilak Varma has rammed into Pretorius and for a moment the South African is down, but gets up. Driven hard to Magala at mid-off, a fumble and Tilak wanted a quick single, sent back, Pretorius in trying to field the throw was unware of Tilak getting back and the bat went into the allrounder's body. Luckily no damage done
Pretorius to Tim David, 1 run, full outside off, Tim David gets forward to drive and a thick inside-edge goes away to the square leg region
Pretorius to Tilak Varma, , the slower ball off-cutter is well outside the tramline on the off-side

Pretorius to Tilak Varma, no run, another slower ball outside off, Tilak Varma could have left that and got a wide, reaches for it and mistimes the drive, another thick inside-edge and it does not go anywhere
Pretorius to Tilak Varma, , Pretorius fails to get the slower ball off-cutter inside the tramline on the off-side
Pretorius to Tilak Varma, 1 run, this time he gets the slower ball off-cutter outside off, Tilak Varma gets forward to drive to long-off
Pretorius to Tim David, 1 run, Tim David is struggling with his timing, another plink as he goes on the back foot to pull and finds long-on
Jadeja to Tim David, 1 run, full on the stumps, Tim David gets forward to drive, thick outside-edge goes to the left of short third man
Tim David is struggling out there
Jadeja to Tilak Varma, 1 run, fullish on off, Tilak Varma gets forward to flick to deep mid-wicket
Jadeja to Tim David, 1 run, flat good length on off, Tim David punches to long-off. This was bowled at 101.5kph
Jadeja to Tilak Varma, no run, bit slower outside off, Tilak Varma punches the good length delivery to cover
Jadeja to Tilak Varma, , finally Tilak Varma breaks the shackles. Fired down leg, he goes down on one knee and swings it away to the fine-leg fence, short boundary and easy hit
If there's no bat, Varma is dead. Not turning too sharply to miss either. No bat as UltraEdge shows. We move on to ball-tracking. Three reds and gone.
Jadeja to Tilak Varma,  Lbw!!

Jadeja to Tilak Varma,  Lbw!! Jadeja ends his spell with a big wicket. Slowed it down after the last ball, on off and middle, Tilak Varma gets forward to flick and plays across the line, misses and is rapped on the pads low. No inside-edge and it is crashing into the top of middle-stump. Varma  even though one can't blame him for taking it considering his side's situation.
Pretorius to Tim David, 1 run, slower ball full on the pads, flicked to deep mid-wicket
Pretorius to Tristan Stubbs, 1 run, full and seam-up on the stumps, Tristan Stubbs flicks to deep mid-wicket to get off the mark
Pretorius to Tristan Stubbs, 1 run, full and seam-up on the stumps, Tristan Stubbs flicks to deep mid-wicket to get off the mark
Pretorius to Tim David, no run, a low full-toss outside off, Tim David has smashed it straight to the fielder at extra-cover who's on the edge of the ring
Pretorius to Tim David, 1 run, good length outside off, fraction short and Tim David cuts hard and straight to sweeper cover
Pretorius to Tristan Stubbs, no run, slower ball off-cutter outside off, bit of extra bounce on this back of a length delivery, Tristan Stubbs plays a half-hearted cut and misses
Pretorius to Tristan Stubbs, no run, was a wide had Tristan Stubbs stayed in his original batting stance, shuffles across and misses the cut to a wide delivery outside off
Santner to Tim David, 1 run, slower and tossed up just outside off, Tim David gets forward and drives to sweeper cover

Santner to Tristan Stubbs, no run,  Now Santner is slowing it down, such a clever bowler he is, Tristan Stubbs goes on the back foot to punch the good length delivery and nearly finds his South African mate
Santner to Tristan Stubbs, 1 run, flat on a good length on the stumps, Tristan Stubbs goes on the back foot and taps it wide of cover for a quick single
Santner to Tim David, no run, looped up and above the eyeline, Tim David slogs as he aims for mid-wicket, misses,
Santner to Tim David, 1 run, 70.7kph, Tim David had to really wait for this good length ball to come, then cuts it wide of cover after making a hint of room
Santner to Tristan Stubbs, 1 run, tossed up full outside off, Tristan Stubbs gets forward and lofts on the bounce to long-off

CSK again bossing with spin and MI have no answers. Tim David is really struggling to get anything away as Dhoni goes for spin. Count Pretorious too as a spinner for he is bowling fast offbreaks with his off-cutters. The injury to Chahar hasn't made an iota of difference so far.
Magala to Tristan Stubbs, no run, now Magala is bowling fast off-cutters! On a good length outside off, Tristan Stubbs dabs to backward point and is sent back
Tim David goes up to Tristan Stubbs to have a word
Magala to Tristan Stubbs, 1 run, full and seam-up on the stumps, Tristan Stubbs eases it down to long-on
Magala to Tim David, 1 run, off-cutter slower ball dug in outside off, Tim David pulls to deep mid-wicket
Magala to Tristan Stubbs, 1 run, Tristan Stubbs makes room outside the leg-stump and Magala bowls the attempted yorker, which is a low full-toss, driven to long-on
Missing the Pandya and Pollard kind of innings that would revive MI from these kinda situations.
Magala to Tim David, 1 run, full on the stumps, clipped to deep mid-wicket
Magala to Tim David, 1 run, full on the stumps, clipped to deep mid-wicket
Magala to Tristan Stubbs,  Caught!!

Magala to Tristan Stubbs,  Caught by Gaikwad!! Good tag-team work from Pretorius and Gaikwad sees the end of Tristan Stubbs. Tristan Stubbs comes down the track and it's another slower ball off-cutter outside off, he slices the loft, Pretorius slightly misjudged that as he tracked back at long-off, takes it over his head but losing his balance and going outside the cushions, so lobs it up and Gaikwad from long-on is there to take a simple catch. No need for the third ump to check if it was a clean catch.
Tushar Deshpande to Tim David, 1 run,  Full outside off, a flat loft from Tim David, Gaikwad ran in and dived low forward but cannot hang on. Not an easy catch but should have been taken
Tushar Deshpande to Hrithik Shokeen, 1 run, short of length outside off, dabbed to the vacant gully region
Tushar Deshpande to Tim David, , this is what Tim David can do. But this is a half-volley outside off, in the slot and slaughtered back over the sightscreen straight down the ground

Tushar Deshpande to Tim David, , Senapati the sub from sweeper cover runs to his left and fails to stop it cleanly, the ball rolls away into the cushions. Sloppy. The slower ball off-cutter outside off is short and Tim David cut that hard

Tushar Deshpande to Tim David, , now Tim David is cashing in. But this is poor bowling. Full and too much width outside off, allows David to free his arms and lofts it over extra-cover, short boundary and easily over
Tushar Deshpande to Tim David,  Caught!!

Tushar Deshpande to Tim David,  Caught by Rahane!! Tushar Deshpande has his revenge. It's a big wicket for Tim David was beginning to look dangerous. A slower ball off-cutter outside off, David did not go hard on the pull, was a sort of a half-hearted shot, a flat hit but straight to the fielder at deep mid-wicket. Rahane is as safe as they come, he does not drop that and David is livid as he walks back. Deshpande though is venting out all his frustration as he utters a few curse words.
Pretorius to Hrithik Shokeen, no run, full outside off, Hrithik Shokeen gets forward to drive to the left of Pretorius
Pretorius to Hrithik Shokeen, 1 run, slower ball off-cutter outside off, Hrithik Shokeen works it to deep square leg
Pretorius to Chawla, 1 run, slower ball off-cutter outside off, Chawla gets forward to drive to sweeper cover
Pretorius to Hrithik Shokeen, no run, slower ball off-cutter dug in short outside off, gets extra bounce, beats the upper-cut of Hrithik Shokeen
Pretorius to Hrithik Shokeen, 1 run, another slower ball off-cutter outside off, Hrithik Shokeen punches nicely but straight to the fielder at sweeper cover
Pretorius to Chawla, 1 run, full on the stumps, seam-up, drilled to long-off
Pretorius to Chawla, 1 run, full on the stumps, seam-up, drilled to long-off
Magala to Chawla, 1 run, low full-toss on the stumps, driven to long-on
Magala to Hrithik Shokeen, 1 run, slower ball off-cutter outside off, Hrithik Shokeen is deceived as he does not pick it, but his flick lands in the vacant mid-wicket area

SKY is clouded, hazy and certainly gloomy now. He only needs to reach out to the Aussie legend Greg Chappell, who had a similar rut in the early 80s. He got out of it quickly and had a very fruitful period leading into his retirement in 84.
Magala to Chawla, 1 run, slower ball full outside off, Chawla loses all shape as he slogs but the thick inside-edge goes to deep mid-wicket
Magala to Hrithik Shokeen, 1 run, full seam-up on off, Hrithik Shokeen lofts wide of mid-off but Gaikwad gets across and cuts it off
Magala to Chawla, leg byes, 1 run, pitches outside the leg-stump, Chawla flicks and misses, takes a legbye
Magala to Hrithik Shokeen, 1 run, full seam-up on the stumps, hint of tail back in, Hrithik Shokeen heaves and gets it down to deep backward square leg

Pretorius to Hrithik Shokeen, , thick leading-edge and lucky boundary for Hrithik Shokeen and MI. Deceived by the slower ball on middle-stump, Shokeen flicks and the leading-edge clears Magala at short third man
Pretorius to Hrithik Shokeen, , the wide yorker is just wide of the tramline on the off-side

Pretorius to Hrithik Shokeen, byes, 1 run, slower ball off-cutter outside off, Hrithik Shokeen slogs and misses, awkward bounce for MS who misses too, but Deshpande at short fine-leg gets across and cuts it off with a slide, keeps it to one
Pretorius to Chawla, 1 run, slower ball off-cutter dug in on the stumps, Chawla loses one hand as he pulls to deep square leg
Pretorius to Hrithik Shokeen, , now a top-edge clears MSD. The 150 is up for MI. Dug in short and slower outside off, Hrithik Shokeen pulls and the top-edge is handy
Pretorius to Hrithik Shokeen, , another attempted wide yorker goes wide of the tramline on the off-side even as Hrithik Shokeen reaches for it and misses
Pretorius to Hrithik Shokeen, , mid-off is up and Pretorius bowls a low full-toss wide outside off, Hrithik Shokeen gets across and lofts well, one bounce over the ropes

I fail to understand MI's stubbornness of not giving chance to Brevis and Arjun Tendulkar. Would have understand is they were doing well and didn't want to disturb the combination but that is not the case here !!
Hrithik Shokeen has reviewed this for a wide outside off. MS and Pretorius are walking off. They think this is a fair delivery. It's not a wide says the third ump as the batsman has moved

Pretorius to Hrithik Shokeen, no run, Hrithik Shokeen reviews and loses. The wide yorker is just wide of the tramline on the off-side but Shokeen has moved too, so the line moves, he fails to dig it out, MS with gloves on threatens to throw down the stumps and prevents the bye.
Dhoni's warning in the last match's presentation has worked wonders. There hasn't been a single no ball in this innings, and just five wides.

16 off the last over has given MI 157. Handy runs there but still CSK will be very happy with their effort. Once again it is CSK's spinners who have done the trick on a good batting pitch. A bit of hold and nothing more on that pitch, but Santner and Jadeja came to the party in those middle overs, combined superbly to take 5 wickets among themselves to cripple MI. From 64-1, MI slipped to 76-5 and MS soon brought on Pretorius who too bowled fast off-cutters to further deny any pace. Tim David struggled for any rhythm till he was dropped by Gaikwad and then smashed Deshpande for 16 off his next 3 balls to look dangerous, however he fell to the last ball of that over and some crucial boundaries by Hrithik Shokeen at the end pushed MI over 150. Lots of starts for Rohit, Ishan Kishan and Tilak Varma but they failed to kick on and CSK will be favorites to chase this down. Back for the reply in 5 minutes...

The total a bit below par. It did spin a bit, slower balls holding up. Started pretty flat. Hopefully the dew will play a factor as well. We saw a couple grip so I went a bit slower to get overspin, and Jadeja always bowls well. The atmosphere is awesome, first time in a few years. It was a cracking crowd when we played at home as well, definitely different from New Zealand.
Welcome back. The bowlers have done their job for CSK, now time for Rutu and Conway to show their prowess. MI need early wickets, Behrendorff with the new ball...
Behrendorff to Conway, no run, good length and nipped away from Conway, a play and a miss!! An encouraging start...
Conway backs out last moment. Issues with the sightscreen. Behrendorff will have to reload
Behrendorff to Conway, no run, on a length and shaping away nicely, plenty of movement. Conway had a poke and missed
Behrendorff to Conway, no run, slightly back of a length and goes straight over off stump. Conway tries to pull but the ball goes under him
Behrendorff to Conway,  Bowled!!

Behrendorff to Conway,  Bowled!! Chopped on!! The wicket MI needed, Behrendorff is pumped. Conway was looking tentative and this was always on the cards. A bit back of length and seams in late from outside off. Conway tries to cut it towards point but inside edges it onto leg stump. The Kiwi opener walks back without scoring...
Behrendorff to Rahane, 2 runs, on a length and slower, holds on the surface. Rahane guides it late through cover point to get off the mark
Behrendorff to Rahane, leg byes, , length ball that strays in line. Off the hips and trickles away to the fine leg boundary
Arshad Khan to Gaikwad, , full but errs on line and ends down the leg side
Arshad Khan to Gaikwad, 1 run, good length and angles on towards off. Gaikwad with a gentle push towards mid-off to get going
Arshad Khan to Rahane, 1 run, full on the pads, clipped behind square for a single
Arshad Khan to Gaikwad, , fuller but too far outside off. Left alone and called wide
Arshad Khan to Gaikwad, no run, on a length and angling outside off, Gaikwad leaves
Arshad Khan to Gaikwad, 1 run, length ball swinging onto the pads, turned towards deep backward square leg
Arshad Khan to Rahane, 1 run, full on the pads, neatly clipped towards deep backward square leg again.
Arshad Khan to Rahane, 1 run, full on the pads, neatly clipped towards deep backward square leg again.
Arshad Khan to Gaikwad, no run, a tad fuller and jags in onto the pads. Arshad appeals for LBW but Gaikwad might have got an inside edge, or either way it was swinging too much...
Behrendorff to Rahane, 2 runs, back of a length angling away, punched through short cover where a misfield allows Rahane two runs
Behrendorff to Rahane, no run, on a length on leg, Rahane tries to flick it behind square but doesn't connect it sweetly. Lobs off his bat and thigh pad to the left of Kishan
Behrendorff to Rahane, , short on the body, pulled with more conviction and lands beyond fine leg. The benefit of having a short boundary...
Behrendorff to Rahane, 1 run, back of a length and closer to off, Rahane gets an inside edge on his punch onto his pads and the batters scamper for the single
Behrendorff to Gaikwad, no run, short outside off, left alone to the keeper by Gaikwad
Behrendorff to Gaikwad, no run, punches the ball on the up and finds the man at mid-off. That was hit off the back foot as he stood tall to punch it off the back foot

Arshad Khan to Rahane, , whipped away for a sixer! Woah Rahane. He is in fine rhythm. That was swinging down on to the pads and Rahane lofted it over fine leg for a sixer. Second time he has sent it over the fence. He is timing them so well
Arshad Khan to Rahane, , short, wide, gets the treatment it deserved. That was slashed past point for a four. Hung back and smashed it hard

Arshad Khan to Rahane, , four more. He is on a roll. Jinks like never before. The brains before brawns now, Was a short of length delivery outside off, Rahane waited on it and guided it past the man at short third for a four. Where have you been hiding, Jinks?

Arshad Khan to Rahane, , oh my my! He is tearing into this young guy. Short, wide, Rahane cracks that off the back foot for a four. 31 off 12 for Rahane! Rub your eyes or pinch yourself? He is putting on some show. The local lad is taking MI down

Arshad Khan to Rahane, , SRTesque! That's a treat to your hungry eyes. Fuller ball, little back lift, comes down on it and punches the drive past the bowler for a four. 22 off the over. He is making a meal of this over
Arshad Khan to Rahane, 1 run, short, wide, Rahane for a change doesn't time it and gets a single. Sanity!!!

What does MS know that we don't? What does this yellow jersey do to people? Rahane was picked for 50 Lakhs INR ICYMI. He has been as hot as a plate of sizzling brownie! Gaikwad has been the ice cream at the other end.
Green to Rahane, 1 run, stabs a length delivery down into the off-side for a single as that was just outside off
Green to Gaikwad, 1 run, hangs back, happy to tap it down into the off-side for a single
Yes, there were a few bad balls but Rahane has been packing a punch in his shots.

Green to Rahane, , ho ho ho! He has lit up the stadium. The sea of blue not liking this for sure. Was a length delivery on the pads, Rahane dispatches it with elan. Such finesse, such class. Top notch stuff from Rahane

Green to Rahane, , ho ho ho! He has lit up the stadium. The sea of blue not liking this for sure. Was a length delivery on the pads, Rahane dispatches it with elan. Such finesse, such class. Top notch stuff from Rahane
Green to Rahane, 1 run, and creams this through the off-side for a single as that was a length delivery outside off
Green to Gaikwad, , slips that full and down leg. Gaikwad looks for a pick up shot and misses. Was wided
Green to Gaikwad, no run, on a length, little shape, Gaikwad pats the ball down under his nose. Gaikwad has batted with a lot of calm. I0$
Green to Gaikwad, 1 run, silken clip off the pads and the man at deep mid cuts it off. That was a fuller delivery angled on to the pads for the batter to put it away
Here is spin. Chawla to spin it back for MI? He is a former yellow fellow.
Chawla to Gaikwad, 1 run, tossed up delivery, outside off, Gaikwad drives the ball down to long-off for a single

Chawla to Rahane, , the midas continues...tossed up ball outside off and Rahane didn't control the drive a lot and the ball came off the outer-half of the bat but got it through the gap for a four. He has moved to 48 off 18 balls
Chawla to Rahane, ,  He has been phenomenal today. He has been too hot to handle. Rahane waited on the short ball, went back and smashed the pull past the man at square leg for a four
Chawla to Rahane, 1 run, waits on it and tucks that down to mid-wicket for a single
Chawla to Gaikwad, 2 runs, well tossed up outside off, Gaikwad just lifts the ball down pretty straightish and the man at long-off came in and dived as well but unable to stop the second
Chawla to Gaikwad, 1 run, was a googly, outside off, Gaikwad drives the ball down to long-off for a single

I0$ That's news for sure. Sorry, that's breaking news. Breaking the internet kind of knock so far. He has oozed class in his little knock so far. He hasn't tried to hit it hard and has relied on timing and placement. Conway was shown the way to the dug-out by Behrendorff. MI bowlers will look to bounce back now after having given away plenty of runs in the first 6.
Kartikeya to Gaikwad, 1 run, flatter one, outside off, Gaikwad drives it down to long-off for a single
Kartikeya to Rahane, 1 run, and sensible from Rahane as he pats the pull down but an excellent stop from the man at deep square prevents the boundary. That was timed well again
Kartikeya to Rahane, 1 run, and sensible from Rahane as he pats the pull down but an excellent stop from the man at deep square prevents the boundary. That was timed well again
Kartikeya to Gaikwad, 1 run, goes back and tucks it wide of long-on for a single. Used the depth of the crease
Kartikeya to Rahane, 1 run, goes back to a flatter one and inner-halves the ball down to short fine for a single. Singles will do for CSK
If you'd told me Rahane would get a game for CSK this IPL and score a 19 ball 50 before the season, I certainly wouldn't have believed you!
Kartikeya to Gaikwad, 1 run, and waits on it and just pushes it out to deep cover for a single
Kartikeya to Rahane, 1 run, fuller ball on the pads, clipped down to deep mid for a single. They were pushing for a secong before changing their minds
Chawla to Rahane, 1 run, doesn't commit much and nudges the ball down on to the on-side for a single. That didn't spin much
Chawla to Gaikwad, 2 runs, and they get a brace! That was in the gap after Gaikwad clipped a fuller ball away. The man at long-on cut it off
Chawla to Gaikwad, 1 run, the ball holds up a little on the deck I suppose as the tuck went uppishly down to deep mid for a single

Chawla to Rahane, , the indomitable Rahane continues his good run. Charges down, gets to the pitch of the ball and lofts it off the pads and away from the man at deep mid for a four. He is batting like a dream
Chawla to Rahane, no run, tossed up delivery, leggie, Rahane pushes it out but fails to beat the man at cover. No run there
Chawla to Rahane,  Caught!!

Chawla to Rahane,  Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! And that's what MI wanted Chawla to do and he has done it. The danger man is gone. The batter wanted to punch it down the ground but ended up cue-ending to the man at long-on. Simple take for the fielder in the deep. Did the ball hold on to the deck a little? Might well have been the case as Rahane has seldom mistimed anything barring this. The moment he hit it, he knew it. But an excellent knock comes to an end.

Green to Gaikwad, no run, angles the ball in, Gaikwad looks to nudge it away but fails to wood it. The ball dribbled to the keeper and he had a shy at the batter's end as Gaikwad harboured thoughts of a single
Green to Gaikwad, 1 run, waits on that short of length delivery outside off and dabs the ball down past point for a single
Green to Shivam Dube, no run, back of a length delivery angled across, Shivam Dube goes back and pats the ball down into the off-side with soft hands

Green to Shivam Dube, 2 runs, banged in short, Shivam Dube mistimes the pull and gets it for a couple as the man at deep mid failed to cut it off. Wasn't a great throw at the keeper's end else it would have been close
When everyone thought Rahane was finished. He is back with a bang. Selection concerns not just for CSK but also Team India. Looks like the lad is eyeing a spot in the WTC Finals.

Green to Shivam Dube, no run, banged in short, Shivam Dube goes for the pull and top-edges it down to mid-off. The ball landed short of the fielder who had a shy at the bowler's end. But Gaikwad hadn't moved much
Green to Shivam Dube, 1 run, gets hold of the short ball, gets hold of the pull and sends it down to deep square for a single
Green to Shivam Dube, 1 run, gets hold of the short ball, gets hold of the pull and sends it down to deep square for a single

Chawla to Shivam Dube, , and that's exactly why Shivam Dube has been sent at 4! Was a tossed up delivery and Shivam Dube got his front foot out of the way to smash it past long-on. Was drilled down the ground
Chawla to Shivam Dube, no run, tossed up delivery, outside off, Shivam Dube gets forward and pushes it out into the off-side
Chawla to Shivam Dube, 1 run, drops it short does Chawla and has been slashed down to deep cover for a single

Chawla to Gaikwad, , the CSK juggernaut is hard to stop tonight. Lovely timing and placement from Mr. Consistent! Was a tossed up delivery and Gaikwad got forward and silked the drive past cover for a four
Chawla to Gaikwad, 1 run, goes back and pats the ball down into the off-side for a single
Chawla to Shivam Dube, 1 run, lunges forward and pushes it down to long-on for a single.
Green to Shivam Dube, 2 runs, short ball, no prizes for guessing the type of delivery to Shivam Dube. Shivam Dube pulls that past mid-on for a couple of runs
Green to Shivam Dube, no run, stays leg-side of the short of length delivery angled across and stabs it down into the off-side to find the man at cover
Green to Shivam Dube, no run, fuller length delivery, angled across, Shivam Dube cue-ends it down to mid-off
Viresh Jain If Rahane had the intentions of playing WTC finals,he would have been playing county in England like Pujara now.Think so he is eyeing a place in WC23!!
Green to Shivam Dube, 1 run, pats the length delivery down to long-off for a single. Played that off the front foot sans much feet movement. The ton is up for CSK
Green to Gaikwad, 1 run, too full, Gaikwad is happy to bargain a single off that delivery as he sends it down to long-on. 57 needed off 55 balls now
Green to Shivam Dube, 1 run, punches the drive on the up and sends it down to long-off for a single. Again not a lot of feet into the shot
Hrithik Shokeen to Shivam Dube, 1 run, goes back and punches that down to long-off for a single. That was a flatter one outside off
Hrithik Shokeen to Gaikwad, 1 run, goes wide of the crease but Gaikwad treks back and punches it down to long-on for a single
Hrithik Shokeen to Shivam Dube, no run, gets forward and nudges the ball down to find the man at mid-wicket
Hrithik Shokeen to Shivam Dube, , and gets it away past deep mid for a four. Poor delivery by Hrithik Shokeen and Shivam Dube went back to slam the pull. Had to wait a little longer for the shot
Hrithik Shokeen to Shivam Dube, no run, gets forward and defends it back to the bowler
Hrithik Shokeen to Shivam Dube, no run, goes back and slaps the delivery down to mid-off. Failed to place it
Hrithik Shokeen to Shivam Dube, no run, goes back and slaps the delivery down to mid-off. Failed to place it
Kartikeya to Gaikwad, no run, chips the drive away sans much control and the ball lands short of the man at cover
Kartikeya to Gaikwad, 1 run, gets that down to deep mid for a single
Kartikeya to Shivam Dube, 1 run, flatter one outside off, punched past the bowler for a single
Kartikeya to Gaikwad, 1 run, well tossed up delivery, driven down to long-off for a single
Kartikeya to Shivam Dube, no run, was from the back of the hand, slower as well, stabbed back to the bowler
Kartikeya to Shivam Dube, 1 run, quicker one on to the pads, tucked down to deep mid for a single to end the over. Decent over from Kartikeya

Hrithik Shokeen to Shivam Dube, , pushed quicker and fuller. In the swinging arc for Shivam Dube and he clears his front leg to give it a big slog over long-on. Six on most grounds, a huge six at the Wankhede!
Hrithik Shokeen to Shivam Dube, 1 run, flat on the pads, turned towards deep backward square leg
Hrithik Shokeen to Gaikwad, 1 run, flat and skids onto off, pulled towards deep mid-wicket
Hrithik Shokeen to Shivam Dube, 1 run, slow on off, pushed to the right of covers for a single
Hrithik Shokeen to Gaikwad, , half tracker on the pads, slapped hard to the right of deep mid-wicket. Ruturaj joins the act...
Hrithik Shokeen to Gaikwad, no run, flat and just outside off, Gaikwad wanted to punch it over the infield but gets it tamely towards extra cover
Kartikeya to Shivam Dube, no run, flighted up on off, Dube waits for the turn and blocks
Kartikeya to Shivam Dube,  Bowled!!

Kartikeya to Shivam Dube,  Bowled!! Dragged on!! A soft dismissal for Shivam Dube. This was a gentle length ball, Dube waits a long time to cut behind square. But just gets an underedge back onto the stumps.
Kartikeya to Rayudu, 1 run, generous flight on off, driven towards long-off
Kartikeya to Gaikwad, , low full toss, slips out the hands and Ruturaj Gaikwad whacks it beyond the deep mid-wicket boundary for six!!
Kartikeya to Gaikwad, , low full toss, slips out the hands and Ruturaj Gaikwad whacks it beyond the deep mid-wicket boundary for six!!
Kartikeya to Gaikwad, no run, fuller and quicker just outside off, pushed towards cover point
Kartikeya to Gaikwad, 2 runs, flat outside off, cut towards deep cover for a couple. A slight fumble there from the deep fielder.
ICYMI, Ambati Rayudu is actually the impact sub, replaces Deepak Chahar.
Chawla to Rayudu, no run, flat and skids on. Rayudu almost chopped on. Onto his pads, saved!
Chawla to Rayudu, no run, tossed up delivery, defended
Chawla to Rayudu, no run, flighted again, pushed back to the bowler
Chawla to Rayudu, no run, tossed up again, another dead bat defence
Chawla to Rayudu, 1 run, flighted up, driven past covers and towards wide long-off
Chawla to Gaikwad, no run, googly, punched towards extra cover off the backfoot
Kartikeya to Rayudu, no run, gentle length ball, cut towards covers off the backfoot
Kartikeya to Rayudu, 1 run, tossed up, driven to long-off
Kartikeya to Gaikwad, 1 run, flat, cut towards backward point where a slight fumble allows a single
Kartikeya to Rayudu, 1 run, tossed up on middle, driven to long-off
Kartikeya to Gaikwad, 1 run, flat and straight, punched towards long-on off the backfoot
CSK doing it in singles...
Kartikeya to Rayudu, 1 run, fired quicker on off, Rayudu dances out and drives to long-off
Kartikeya to Rayudu, 1 run, fired quicker on off, Rayudu dances out and drives to long-off
Kartikeya to Rayudu, 1 run, fired quicker on off, Rayudu dances out and drives to long-off
Behrendorff to Rayudu, , low full toss, Rayudu nicely places his drive to the right of extra cover and left of long-off. Runs away for four...
Behrendorff to Rayudu, , low full toss, Rayudu nicely places his drive to the right of extra cover and left of long-off. Runs away for four...
Was a perfect opportunity to try out Subhranshu instead of Rayudu.
Was a perfect opportunity to try out Subhranshu instead of Rayudu.
Behrendorff to Rayudu, , short, too short and goes over Rayudu's head
Behrendorff to Rayudu, , short, too short and goes over Rayudu's head
Behrendorff to Rayudu, , yorker length angling in from round the wicket. Rayudu gets a thick leading edge that runs away to the left of short third for a boundary...
Behrendorff to Rayudu, , yorker length angling in from round the wicket. Rayudu gets a thick leading edge that runs away to the left of short third for a boundary...
Behrendorff to Rayudu, 2 runs, full and under the bat. Rayudu lifts it over the bowler's head but long-off cuts it off
Behrendorff to Rayudu, 2 runs, full and under the bat. Rayudu lifts it over the bowler's head but long-off cuts it off
Dhoni padding up. Gets a loud cheer as the camera pans to him. Imagine how it would be if there is a loss of a wicket then...
Dhoni padding up. Gets a loud cheer as the camera pans to him. Imagine how it would be if there is a loss of a wicket then...
Dube can't play just as a batter. Worse, his batting style has been figured out as well.
Dube can't play just as a batter. Worse, his batting style has been figured out as well.
Behrendorff to Rayudu, no run, full on off, pushed back to the bowler
Behrendorff to Rayudu, no run, full on off, pushed back to the bowler
Behrendorff to Rayudu, 1 run, full and wide, Rayudu goes for a slash and gets a thick edge that goes towards deep point
Behrendorff to Rayudu, 1 run, full and wide, Rayudu goes for a slash and gets a thick edge that goes towards deep point
Behrendorff to Gaikwad, 1 run, low full toss, turned towards cow corner.
Behrendorff to Gaikwad, 1 run, low full toss, turned towards cow corner.
Arshad Khan to Gaikwad, , wide yorker, too wide and even Kishan can only parry towards short third. CSK take two extra runs...
Arshad Khan to Gaikwad, , wide yorker, too wide and even Kishan can only parry towards short third. CSK take two extra runs...

Arshad Khan to Rayudu, , game, set, match!! An empathic win for CSK at the home of their enemy. This was a nice slot ball outside off, Rayudu swung his willow and gets it wide of long-off. Races away to the fence...

Arshad Khan to Rayudu, , game, set, match!! An empathic win for CSK at the home of their enemy. This was a nice slot ball outside off, Rayudu swung his willow and gets it wide of long-off. Races away to the fence...

These two sides finished last and second from last in the previous season. And it looks like one team has learnt their lesson, and unfortunately it isn’t the team in blue. The same problems plague Mumbai Indians - their big name batters aren’t pulling their weight. Today the top-order was outdone with some simple left-arm orthodox spin. Their bowlers aren’t doing any better as well, as a Jasprit Bumrah sized void can’t be filled with any permutations and combinations that they try. Their spinners lack any real wicket taking ability and the pacers they are bringing in are failing at this level. Not looking very good…

These two sides finished last and second from last in the previous season. And it looks like one team has learnt their lesson, and unfortunately it isn’t the team in blue. The same problems plague Mumbai Indians - their big name batters aren’t pulling their weight. Today the top-order was outdone with some simple left-arm orthodox spin. Their bowlers aren’t doing any better as well, as a Jasprit Bumrah sized void can’t be filled with any permutations and combinations that they try. Their spinners lack any real wicket taking ability and the pacers they are bringing in are failing at this level. Not looking very good…

But forget all that. Because today was all about one man. One man who came out of syllabus and ended up smashing the fastest IPL fifty of the season. And he did so with pure cricketing shots, not one slog, not one shot in anger. A loud clarion call from Ajinkya Rahane that he is not yet finished!! Rahane couldn’t stay the course, but he did enough to leave the result to just a mere formality. Shivam Dube came out and played a few big shots, but then chopped one back onto his stumps. Ruturaj stayed till the end, as impact sub Rayudu joined him to finish the game off. A big boost to NRR as well for CSK. Now wait on for the presentations…

And he did so with pure cricketing shots, not one slog, not one shot in anger. A loud clarion call from Ajinkya Rahane that he is not yet finished!! Rahane couldn’t stay the course, but he did enough to leave the result to just a mere formality. Shivam Dube came out and played a few big shots, but then chopped one back onto his stumps. Ruturaj stayed till the end, as impact sub Rayudu joined him to finish the game off. A big boost to NRR as well for CSK. Now wait on for the presentations…

We lost our way in the middle, did not capitalise on the start we got. It was a good pitch, 30-40 runs short and could not capitalise in the middle overs. Got to credit their spinners, they bowled well and kept us under pressure. You need to try out different things, you need to attack and be brave. We have got a couple of young guys and got to give some time to them. They have real talent and we have to back them and show trust in their ability which we are doing. The senior guys need to step up starting with me. We know the nature of IPL, when the tournament starts we need to get some momentum and when you don't it is tough. Just two games and all is not lost still. If you win, you can win a few on the trot and when you lose it is hard to come out of that momentum. Hopefully things start to change. Things we speak in the changeroom has not worked in the middle. We know we had a very disappointing last season, but we always start afresh, even when we won the 5 trophies, we never thought we won it last year. Every opposition is quality here and we need to be at our best to beat them. These two games has happened, we can't change. Of course we can learn and be more brave in changing things on the field.

Every opposition is quality here and we need to be at our best to beat them. These two games has happened, we can't change. Of course we can learn and be more brave in changing things on the field.

Really enjoyed it, I got to know before the toss. Moeen was unwell. And Flem told me I was playing. Had a good domestic season. I just try to maintain my shape. Focus on timing. It is all about you have to feel that you are playing a match. IPL is a long tournament and you never know when you get an opportunity. I always enjoy playing at Wankhede. I have never played a Test here. I would want to play a Test here. Important thing about Mahi bhai and Fleming is they give freedom to everyone. Mahi bhai told me to prepare well.

Feels good. Not to forget we lost Deepak in the first over. He's our new ball bowler and Magala playing his first match. The good thing is spinners bowled well. It was a bit two-paced after 7 overs, started turning. The spinners and the fast bowlers came back well. Magala was good and so was Pretorius. We believe in him, and when you're new you are under pressure but playing in the IPL for a few years brings different pressure [on Deshpande]. He had a great domestic season, he is improving. He has a lot of potential but he can improve by not bowling those no-balls, and by being more consistent. Me and Jinks spoke at the start of the season and I told him to play to his strengths, use your ability to manipulate the fields. I told him to go and enjoy, don't take stress and we'll back you. He batted well and he was not happy with the way he got out, that says it all. I think every game is important, you look at the problems in front of you and take it one step at a time, not look at the league table for now.

When we were bowling, the odd ball was turning. So me and Mitch wanted to bowl in good areas because they have so many powerhitters. Everytime we come here, the wicket plays different - sometimes it is flat, sometimes it is sticky. (On partnership with Santner) We surely discuss, whoever starts advises the other person on what lengths to bowl. We keep talking and advising each other.

That's all for today. A slightly surprising Man of the Match choice, it must be said but can't take anything away from Jadeja's performance as well. He came in after the powerplay and turned the game, but the most memorable moments of today came out of the willow of Ajinkya Rahane. A Mumbai lad through and through, came back to the Wankhede and sunk Mumbai Indians on his CSK debut. Some selection headaches now for the team in yellow.... But that's for another day, for now they can sleep sound knowing they have another win on the board. Hope you guys sleep sound as well, this is  signing off on behalf of  and
